title: Nahuatl Words in English
description: From chocolate to tomato, discover how the Aztec Nahuatl language gave English some of its most delicious words!

questions.question: The word 'chocolate' comes from the Nahuatl 'xocolatl.' What does 'xocolatl' roughly translate to?
Which common fruit's English name comes from the Nahuatl 'tomatl'?
The word 'avocado' comes from the Nahuatl 'ahuacatl.' What did 'ahuacatl' also mean in Nahuatl?
Which English word for a type of coyote comes directly from the Nahuatl 'coyotl'?
The word 'chili' (the pepper) comes from the Nahuatl 'chilli.' How long have chili peppers been cultivated in Mesoamerica?
Which English word for a type of sauce made from avocados comes from the Nahuatl 'ahuacamolli'?
The word 'cacao' (the source of cocoa and chocolate) comes from Nahuatl. What did the Aztecs use cacao beans for besides food?
Which English word for a type of axolotl (a salamander) comes directly from Nahuatl?
The word 'axolotl' in Nahuatl roughly translates to what?
Which word for a flat corn-based bread comes from the Nahuatl word through Spanish?
The word 'mesquite' (a type of tree) comes from the Nahuatl 'mizquitl.' What is mesquite commonly used for?
Which word for an ocelot (a wild cat) comes from the Nahuatl 'ocelotl'?
The word 'tamale' comes from the Nahuatl 'tamalli.' What is a tamale?
options: A corn dough dish wrapped in a corn husk or banana leaf

questions.question: Which type of small dog breed gets its name from a Mexican state, which in turn has Nahuatl origins?
The word 'shack' may derive from the Nahuatl 'xacalli.' What did 'xacalli' mean?
options: A wooden hut or adobe cabin
